==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|あたま|たか|k2=だか|かた|k3=がた|r=y|yomi=kun}}

===Etymology===
From {{compound|頭|高|型|t1=head (beginning)|t2=high|t3=form|lang=ja}}, literally "(in the '''beginning''' the pitch is '''high''')-'''form'''".

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|あたまだかがた|acc=h|y=k}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|あたまだかがた}}
# The pitch accent pattern in Japanese where the first syllable is accented; i.e., the first syllable has high pitch and all subsequent syllables have low pitch, for example in the word {{l|ja|会う|'''会'''う}} ({{lang|ja|'''あ'''う}}, '''a'''u).
